utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. You got in late last night. Catch a case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Actually, it’s this one. Someone blew up an apartment downtown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? And you didn’t call me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you said you had a chapter due.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, which is writer-speak for “all procrastinations welcome”. So what was it? A terrorist plot? A meth lab?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … a canvass turned up a description of a guy fleeing the scene in a silver hatchback. We called in for traffic cam footage which is already probably in, so I gotta get going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or … you have Esposito check that out. He’s very good at it. I feel like I haven’t seen you in days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I really do have to get going, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you’re powerless to resist me. You always have been.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember when we first met? I kind of thought you were an ass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you pretended you thought that, but c’mon. We’re together now. You can admit it. You fell for me the first moment you saw me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please. You did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You believe that, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s true.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hold on. Beckett. Okay. I’ll be right there. Traffic cam footage turned up a match to the plates. We got him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. Wait, wait, wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see the hearts?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Took me, like, 6 minutes.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: The car’s license plate was register to an Archibald Fosse. He lives alone in a fourth floor apartment. This isn’t his first rodeo, either. He got in trouble playing the ponies so he took out his bookie with a car bomb six years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Six years and he’s already out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he’s supposed to do 20 years to life, but his case got overturned on an appeal three months ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea about the motivation for last night’s bombing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. We just ID’d him 20 minutes ago. There’s a lot we have to learn about him yet.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. This is Diego Jiminez. Uniforms intercepted him on his way up to pay Mr. Fosse a visit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know him?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO JIMINEZ
utterance.content: I don’t, really. I’ve never even met him. We connected online. I’m a collector. He said he had some baseball cards from the ‘30s he wanted to sell. That’s all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we know this much. If Diego had an appointment Fosse’s probably in there.

utterance.speaker: SWAT
utterance.content: Move, move! Go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, Espo? He’s coming your way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Freeze! NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop right there!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me see your hands.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop it! Drop it now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What is that? Why is it flashing? Huh? Answer me!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Answer me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Baseball cards. Just like he said.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett, Castle, get out of there now. The suspect had some sort of device in his pocket. I think he armed something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Copy that. Everyone out, now. Let’s go. You guys, out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. I think I’m standing on a bomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long do you think we’ll have to stand here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Once bomb disposal finishes their sweep we’ll know if there are any other bombs you could step on or if I’m standing on the only one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We don’t know that you’re standing on a bomb. It could be nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It didn’t feel like nothing. Something gave way under my feet. Felt like a trigger plate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could be a wonky floorboard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With a metallic click?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Loose nail. That’s how floorboards get wonky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I hope you’re right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m right. I mean, think about it. Who puts a live bomb in their own apartment? Makes no sense. You hungry?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because any minute someone’s going to come through that door and give us the all clear and there is an amazing diner not three blocks from here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? Well, I did miss my breakfast this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, oh, they make these incredible foamy lattes. Cups as big as your head and a goat cheese omelet to die for. Which would be a poor choice of words if you were standing on a bomb, but guess what? You’re not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, if I have to be stuck not standing on a bomb, then I’m glad I’m stuck with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN MAHONEY
utterance.content: Captain Mahoney, bomb disposal unit. Which one of you is Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Beckett. This is Castle.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Castle, you can relax. We’re x-rayed the entire apartment from the floor below. There are no other explosives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No other explosives, so…?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Detective, I’m afraid you’ve stepped on a senor plate wired to a detonator. Depressing that plate was sort of like cocking the hammer of a gun. You take your weight off there it’s like pulling the trigger. So it’s very important that you don’t move ‘til we figure out how to disarm it.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: BDU just confirmed it. Beckett’s standing on a bomb. Trace detection estimates 10 kilograms of RDX, enough to take out the whole building.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what’s the plan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, tell me there’s a plan.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They’re working on it. What do we have on that bomber?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It looks like his motive was revenge. Kelly Runther, the woman he blew up last night, testified against him in his arson trial six years ago.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then why would he booby trap his own apartment?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The defense at his trial centered on allegations of evidence tampering by police, so …

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He’s got a vendetta against cops.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, sir. He wanted this to happen.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well we’re not going to let. You get him in the box. I want to know how to deactivate that bomb.

utterance.speaker: ARCHIBALD FOSSE
utterance.content: What makes you think it can be deactivated?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You better pray that it can, because the person standing on it, she’s a friend of mine.

utterance.speaker: FOSSE
utterance.content: Not for long.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s where you’re wrong. See, you’re going to help us. You know how the bomb is made. The detonator, the fuse, all the other little parts. If they can stop any one of those parts from working, the bomb fails.

utterance.speaker: FOSSE
utterance.content: It’s not going to fail. I’m not done yet. None of this is over.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well then you’re going back to jail as a cop killer. And there’s not a prison around that’s gonna –

utterance.speaker: FOSSE
utterance.content: You want to save your friend? I want a lawyer. Now.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: We’re estimating the trigger plate is about three feet by three feet. So no one crosses this line.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the disarming process? How long does that usually take?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Well that depends on the bomb. We still don’t know what kind of device we’re dealing with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what are we supposed to do in the meantime? Just - can’t have her just stand there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m okay, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you’re not okay. You’re standing – - um – you said stepping on the plate was like cocking the hammer and stepping off the plate was like pulling the trigger. What if we replaced Beckett with something of equal weight? You know, just the old Indiana Jones-golden idol-bag of sand trick?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Remember how that turned out?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Look, the plate she’s standing on can sense even minor fluctuations in pressure. You try to transfer the weight, you’ll set off the bomb. Put any type of protective gear on her, you’ll set off the bomb. She shifts too quickly from one foot to the other –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - set off the bomb. I – I get it. Thank you. I’m sorry. I – so what are we supposed to do? Just stand here?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Not you, Mr. Castle. All nonessential personnel must evacuate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. I am essential personnel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: We’ll take good care of her. I’ve got guys downstairs right now figuring this out. Meantime, Detective, sit tight. I’ll check back with you soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I appreciate it. I’m staying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, please. There is no reason to put yourself in danger. There’s nothing that you can do here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing? Excuse me, who’s going to be your bomb buddy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My bomb buddy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You heard what he said. You’re going to be standing here, maybe for hours. If I don’t stay, who’s going to keep your spirits up? Who’s going to keep your mind off of getting tired?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m going to be fine. I feel fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That would be great if you were a reliable judge of your own feelings, which clearly, you’re not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, exhibit A. According to you, you felt nothing for me when we first met. Which we both know –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you actu – oh, I get it. I know what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what, Castle? Forget it. I’m not going down that path. You can just go now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll leave. If you admit to me you had feelings for me when we first met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. I did have feelings for you when we first me. I couldn’t stand you. Do you even remember what you were like in the beginning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well apparently I was irresistible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Irresistible? Are you joking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Richard Castle, you are under arrest for obstruction of justice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You forgot making you look bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cuff him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bondage. My safe word is apples.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do I look like a killer to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. You kill my patience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guess who’s got a date with a prostitute!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So many lonely women approached me thinking I was their Tom Hanks. I got laid –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t make me shoot you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really am ruggedly handsome, aren’t I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m gonna kill you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do I have to wait for him to sign or can I shoot him now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How shallow are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Very.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call me a muse again and I will break both your legs, ‘kay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘kay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In your dreams.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, in my dreams you’re never jealous. In my dreams you just join i-

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, if you couldn’t stand me when we first met, tell me this. Why couldn’t you keep your hands off me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you even talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you know what I’m talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Of course. Sure, I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooww!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow, ow! Apples, apples!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hold my hand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That? Castle, that was called survival. We were just huddling for warmth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cuddling?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huddling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or, one could say it’s a small part of a larger pattern. Unwanted touching in the workplace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you’re being harassed? Is that it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you’re very lucky. A less understanding man would press charges with all the inappropriate things you’ve said to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, geez. How do you even get in that position?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not even possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, it’s possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, gauntlet your right wrist in your left palm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Shot too soon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, we could always just cuddle, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you just use the work veritable?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sexy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should hear me say fallacious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The closest I ever came to taking an art class was posing for one as a model.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, posing in -?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not a stitch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s the matter, Castle? You afraid of a little role play?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s it? That’s all you’ve got?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s more, but on thinking back I was momentarily distracted by your dizzying array of hairstyles over the years. Anyway …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. Me, in a swim suit, under the hot, blistering sun?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d be happy to rub lotion on you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think this is crazy you should see some of the clubs I’ve been to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know any good tricks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I do this one thing, with ice cubes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is one hot, wild, kinky thing that I do like doing. Putting killers behind bars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please, let’s just stick it in and get this over with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not how I meant it. I can’t help it if you get off by putting things in my mouth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, like that. I can’t even. It’s like candy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, like you’ve never been inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve never been anything but a perfect gentleman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ever have any fun? Let your hair down? Drop your top? A little ‘Cops Gone Wild’?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You do know I’m wearing a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, beat my pants off if you dare.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sex?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll explain how that works later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Slutty nurse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re very good at bossing men around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I find that hot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me tell you something about crazy people. The sex is unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you call to tell me a bedtime story?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d be happy to let you spank me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re handcuffed. Kinky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Strangely arousing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You better not be enjoying this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll let you know in a minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you are not comfortable in a swimsuit you can just skinny dip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I wear boxers, what do you wear? Thong? Cheekies? Bloomers? Granny panties?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Commando?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And talk about unwanted touching?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m gonna go up. Ready? Grab my legs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cas – I said legs, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Legs. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s simply because your legs are so close to your … other bits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Keep telling yourself that, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s going to be okay, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, those guys downstairs, they’ve done this thousands of times.

utterance.speaker: BOMB SQUAD TECH
utterance.content: Captain Mahoney, tactical wants an update.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Well, lack of access is limiting our options. What did you find out about that handheld remote he had?

utterance.speaker: BOMB SQUAD TECH
utterance.content: It definitely activated the bomb. Good news, tech thinks he can deactivate it as well. But we need the right 5 digit code.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: That’s what, 100,000 combinations?

utterance.speaker: BOMB SQUAD TECH
utterance.content: Yeah. And it’s tamper proof. Enter the wrong code and …

utterance.speaker: MIKE BOYER
utterance.content: My client says he’s willing to give you the disarm code, but he has some demands.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Full amnesty. You’ve got to be kidding me, right? This guy killed someone last night.

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: Uh, allegedly killed. Look, I know. I told him you wouldn’t go for it, but if you haven’t noticed he’s got a screw loose.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can work on these other things. Food, clothes, even the phone isn’t impossible, but –

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: He won’t go back to prison, okay? He walks or he won’t help her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boyer, right?

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’ve been out of law school, what? Two, three years?

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: Ten months.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ten months.

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, listen to me. That detective standing on that bomb, she needs to get through this. You understand me?

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: I - I swear, I’m doing what I can.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. I’ll take this list to the DA, but we’re gonna need a plan B.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: DA’s not going for it. Nor should he. Turning this madman loose on society to save a single life, even hers, is against everything we stand for. And Beckett, she’d be the first to agree with that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll go back to the lawyer. See if he can get through to Fosse.

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: So I told him there was a deal to be had, just not for amnesty –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: And he’s still insisting he walk. I figured I’d give him a few minutes to think and try again. Detective, I swear I’m doing everything I can.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BOYER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, do me a favor. Why don’t you keep junior over there busy for me, will you? I’m going to go see our boy in holding.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You want that code, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, what are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s up to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Medic! I need a medic in holding now!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: How in the hell did he get that pen?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That frigging lawyer gave it to him. He was trying to encourage Fosse to come up with some alternate demands.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And instead he just cost us any hope of getting that disarm code.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy just got out of prison a couple months ago. Why would he start killing people and why would he take his own life?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I can answer that. Turns out, Fosse had stage four brain cancer. He found out last month. He was going to die anyway.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So if he was dying why not take his enemies with him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Exactly. And his enemies weren’t limited to cops and last night’s bombing victim. There was another bombing last week in Connecticut. That victim worked for the ADA that put Fosse in jail sex years ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Fosse said “I’m not done yet”.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Make a list of everyone involved with the prosecution at his trial. We need to warn them. There may be other bombs out there. And get all the information on any fragments that were recovered from both bombings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If those bombs were made with any common components could help BDU deactivate the device that Beckett’s on.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Without the disarm code we need to get eyes on the device. We use a fiber optic scope, go in through the ceiling downstairs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that dangerous?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Well, we’ll do everything we can to minimize the risk. We’ll start across the room, snake the cable over. Still, there’ll be some vibrations so there’s always a chance that –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just … do it. I can’t keep standing here forever.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: All right. We’ll go as fast as we can but as slow as we have to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, listen to me –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not leaving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know. But depending on what happens there’s something I need you to do. Something that I can’t do myself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You need me to hind your porn stash so your dad doesn’t find it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you just be serious for a second, please?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. What? What do you need me to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not now, okay? Just promise me you’ll do it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay, yeah. But you don’t need to be thinking like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m just – I’m trying to be realistic, Castle. I’ve been standing here for hours and I’m feeling the fatigue set in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t think about it. Beating fatigue, it’s just … um… it’s mind over body. Escaped POWs have walked hundreds of miles to gain their freedom. Polar explorer Ernest Shackleton rode in a lifeboat 800 miles to save his crew all because of –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can convince yourself of almost anything. Much like you convinced yourself you weren’t crazy about me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I know what you’re trying to do. You’re trying to take my mind off of it and I appreciate that, but do we really have to –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And by the way, you may have convinced yourself, but – – you weren’t fooling anyone else. Not me and certainly not your friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? ‘cause no one ever said anything to me.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Girl, I’m gonna smack you. You work side by side every day. He writes a sex scene in his book about you that had me reaching for ice water. Now little miss bride shows up. Don’t tell me you’re not the least bit jealous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, please. You’ve been inhaling too many autopsy fluids.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Honey, just because you can’t see what’s going on doesn’t mean everyone else doesn’t see what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: NATALIE RHODES
utterance.content: He’s into you. But you’re determined not to give into these feelings that you clearly have for him. So he fantasizes about you through his writing. It’s literally verbal masturbation.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: No, no, no. I get it. You’re hot for Castle. You want to make little Castle babies.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Despite your act, you’re crazy about him. Oh, what? Was that supposed to be some big secret?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. No. Do you think he knows?

utterance.speaker: KYRA
utterance.content: He’s all yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, okay. They might have said something, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They were completely misreading the situation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Much like I must have been misreading the situation all those times you dressed up in revealing outfits to try to turn my head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - no one …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Undercover. I like it. You might want to pop one more button just in case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it my imagination or did you change?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, could you get some backup please?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only reason that I was dressed up was to go undercover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I guess it was just a coincidence that each time I just so happened to be there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it wasn’t a coincidence because you were always following me around. Why? ‘cause you were into me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me into you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. I – I admit I found you not unattractive and occasionally fun to be around. Into you … ... no. Definitely not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Then why were you following me around? And don’t say that it was research, because no one believed that for a second.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really want to know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was because I was … … having so much fun playing cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dead body? Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Drop the gun, dirt bag!

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: What did you call me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dirt – dirtbag. Dirtbag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Booya.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there a police code for zombie on the loose?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Secrets, murder, and gambling. Three of my favorite pastimes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got him! I got him!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bam! So you admit you vandalized Wilder’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I sometimes forget I’m not actually a cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Want me to break out Jake and The Fatman again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woohoo! I always wanted to do that!

utterance.speaker: JONATHAN TISDALE
utterance.content: Drop the gun or I swear to God I’ll –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me you saw that!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A little help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was awesome! I mean, obviously it was horrible, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hate this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. Isn’t it great?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Put your hands in the air and get on your knees while you’re at it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gentlemen, if I’ve learned one thing, it’s to not let a little thing like murder get in the way of having a good time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not why you were following me around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is too. And anything else that you come up with is strictly a product of your imagination.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it’s obvious that you and I are not going to resolve this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you concede?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Seriously? Who liked who first?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s right. Who was in to whom first? Me or Castle?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You do realize that I’m busy trying to save your life?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just answer the question, Espo. Don’t be afraid to hurt his feelings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And don’t forget how jealous she got that time we worked that case at my ex-girlfriend’s wedding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or how jealous he got when I was with Demming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or before that how jealous she got about me and my ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who’re you talking to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or how about when you wrote that sex scene?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s Castle and Beckett. I think they’re starting to crack. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or … jealous about me and Serena Kaye. Or Sophia from the CIA. Or Agent Shaw from the FBI.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or how about when you wrote that sex scene -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, well, totally losing it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, I ran down the bomb fragments from Fosse’s previous attacks. The components he used her completely different. It’s not going to be any help determining what this third bomb is like.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So it’s up to BDU now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Oh God. There’s a timer, too.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Seems like the timer was activated when she stepped on that triggering plate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well, how much time is left?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Thirty minutes and forty-seven seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh …. All right. Um, can we deactivate it by then.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: We’ll try. Trouble is, our usual target’s the fuse, the detonator, the topping pin. They’re all shielded by a steel plate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well there’s gotta be something we can do. We could line the floor with armor. I could just put on one of those Hurt Locker suits, I could just tackle her right off of it.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Castle, if that thing goes off the whole building goes with it. There’s not a suit in the world that’s gonna –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Castle, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, be right there.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: I promise that we’ll do all that we can, but I urge you to be realistic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you, Captain. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good news. They’ve isolated the bomb and they’re deploying their bomb disposal robot. It’s a new prototype model with advanced AI. They’ve had a lot of success in field simulations. It’s –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A prototype robot? I can tell when you’re lying, Castle. You know that. Like when you said that you were following me just to play cop. Now what did he actually say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a timer on the bomb.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About thirty minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, it’s probably just as well. I can’t keep standing here anyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, we will get you out of this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What makes you so sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve been in bad situations before.

utterance.speaker: DICK COONAN
utterance.content: Here’s what’s going to happen. We’re just going to stroll on over to the elevator together. You made a sound and I’ll put a round in this man’s liver and he will die slowly.

utterance.speaker: JERRY TYSON
utterance.content: How close to death do you want to get?

utterance.speaker: JERRY TYSON
utterance.content: Castle! Are you watching? I got your girl!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I feel in situations like this it’s important to have faith.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Help! Castle!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, thank you. For being there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, there is something about us that seems to draw trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you’re forgetting the scariest one of them all.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard! I’m home!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hide!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get in the closet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m not going in the closet!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get in the closet!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just … making the bed.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was terrifying. But, still, as bad as the situation gets we still always find a way out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. So how are we going to find our way out of this one?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I keep thinking, the answer is in Fosse’s story. I mean, something must have set him off. But what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, why does his story matter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The story always matters. That’s actually why we make such a great team. You find the evidence, the evidence helps me build a story, the story points us to the solution.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The keycard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mike’s keycard!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scarlett gave it to him so the two of them could go into business together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Making for one angry blackmailer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was in on it from the start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was thinking the exact same thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I figured out who Zahlman was paid to kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Billionaire philanthropist Christian Dahl?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like we could be twins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I know who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: Him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: He lied.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: The con is still on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: There!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: I know who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you two practice this when we’re not around?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? The story. It’s our secret ingredient.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except when your storytelling devolves into wild speculation. Then it’s just maddening.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. That wild speculation almost always points us to our killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what I don’t get is who would steal a dead body?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Organ harvesters. Cadaverless med students. Satanists. Mad scientists looking to create their own monster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The bullet was made of ice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gun toting Viking? That’s your theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or he’s a vampire.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Recently fired postal workers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here I am looking for evidence and all I had to do was just make something up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The clock was commissioned by a secret society to count down the end of days. A secret society of Santas who are the guardians of time. Oh, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t say spy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or mob it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mob hit of a spy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ninja assassin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mad doctors and B-movie Nazis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Time travelling killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe … no, I got nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The mummy himself has risen from the grave and is roaming New York seeking vengeance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, that’d be cool if it was actually a ghost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t ruin my story with your logic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The actual DVD will not kill me, Esposito, it will be the spirit inside the DVD. Just like in The Ring.

utterance.speaker: ETHAN SLAUGHTER
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s the stupidest thing you’ve said yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So killer cyborg sent from the future, resistance fighters intercept his coordinates redirect him into a pizza oven saving humanity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who needs proof? What a great story!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Men in black.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Psychic predicted her own murder!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our killer’s a zombie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I said ‘almost always’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what bugs me? Why would a guy in a bombing spree be worried about selling his baseball card collection?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wouldn’t. Do you think Fosse was trying to lure the collector here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d say so, seeing as how this receipt says he just bought this collection a week ago. That card collector was going down to the station to make a statement, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Yes. If he’s still there maybe Ryan and Esposito can figure out what Fosse wanted with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Already on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re sure you never met him before? No previous interactions?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: No. He friended me on Facebook a few weeks ago, saw me posting about some trading cards,, said he had some old ones for me to take a look at.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How about any connection to his trial? Even indirectly.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe jobs related to the legal field somehow.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: I’m an administrator for NYSED up in Albany. This is the first time I’ve even been in the city in years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about his victims, Jeffery Sklar, Kelly Runther? Any connection to them?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: Sorry. I’ve never seen them before.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about this list of names connected to the Fosse trial? Do any of those names look familiar? Look again. We’re running out of time.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: I want to help, I do. But I don’t know anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, no. I understand. Thank you, Esposito.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ten minutes. I know. It’s okay, Captain. You did everything you could.

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: We are not giving up. There’ll be guys down there working on this until the last possible moment. But I have to withdraw everyone else. And that includes you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can I just … can I have a moment alone with him, please?

utterance.speaker: MAHONEY
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s time to say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not leaving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you promised you would help me with something when the time came. This is it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please, Castle. Please don’t make this any harder than it needs to be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I wish I could kiss you. I wish – so many things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. There’s no regrets. All in all I think we’ve had a great run.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rick. I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: JIM BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve reached the voicemail of Jim Beckett. Please leave a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Dad, it’s me. I just wanted to hear your voice and … I wanted to tell you that I love you. Okay, that’s all. ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We speak for the dead. That’s the job. We are all they’ve got once the wicked rob them of their voices. We owe them that. But we don’t owe them our lives.

utterance.speaker: JIM BECKETT
utterance.content: Your mother always said that life never delivers anything that we can’t handle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me take you someplace, Kate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someplace you’ll be safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll never be safe.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: There are no victories. There’s only the battle and the best that you can hope for is that you find someplace to make your stand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wish that I had someone who would be there for me and I could be there for him and we could just dive into it together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even on the worst days there’s a possibility for joy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I almost died, and all I could think about was you. I just want you.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t die on me!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: C’mon!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, I love you. I love you, Kate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Napping? ‘cause I can come back later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing here? You promised.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I promised I’d leave, but I didn’t promise I wouldn’t come back. Got coffee for later, when you’re off that thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle, please, you have to leave. There’s no reason for both of us to die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I didn’t come here to die. I came here to diffuse the bomb. There’s still a chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, a one in one hundred thousand chance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. While there is a chance I’m not giving up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, listen to me. I’ve already come to peace with this, and that doesn’t include Alexis losing her father or Martha her son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, what am I supposed to do? Walk out the door while you’re standing all the way over there by yourself?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes! Yes, that’s exactly –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a second. Why are you standing all the way over there? If Fosse set the bomb why not – why not set it by the door so they’d hit it when they came in, unless –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This wasn’t for cops. Then who was it for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The card collector kid. What was his name? Diego. He was on his way up here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Fosse was trying to leverage him for information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, great. So uh, what’s near where you’re standing? The island, cards, computer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I think I can reach that computer from here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You stay there. I’ll – I’ll check it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think Fosse wanted Diego to look something up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe. But what? Checking the browser history – porn … more porn … websites for a couple of PIs … peopletracker.pro? He’s looking for someone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe someone else responsible for putting him in prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you can find practically anyone with the click of a mouse. Why hire a private investigator?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I might have an answer for you. I went through the list of all the people involved in Fosse’s trial. One woman’s been completely scrubbed from the system. Driver’s license, social security number, all gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dorothy Novak. The prosecution’s main witness and Fosse’s girlfriend at the time. The DA just confirmed that his office set her up with a new identity when Fosse got out three months ago. She was afraid Fosse would come after her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like she was right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but how is this Diego Jiminez supposed to help find her?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. He worked at the NYSED.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: New York State Education Department. Wait, were the first two victims related to Fosse’s girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. The woman he killed last night was the girlfriend’s cousin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the first victim worked for the DA’s office. They helped relocate her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fosse didn’t want revenge. He was looking for information from them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wanted to find out his girlfriend’s new identity. He was desperate to find them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right there with you. Does she have a kid?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, she gave birth eight months after the trial. How did you know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s his. He didn’t find out about it until got out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’s why he lured Diego here. Diego had access to state school records. He was trying to find his kid. It was all find- That’s the code. It has to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, see if you can find the kid’s name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Working on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, work fast, buddy. We got two minutes. A story makes sense. Fosse was desperate to see his kid just once before he dies. But the mother has hidden the child away so Fosse lashed out, doing whatever it took to track them down. Told you we’d figure this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, there’s barely a minute left. You’ve got to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please, if he finds the name, I’ll type it in myself. If not –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’ll come through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He has to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: William. The kid’s name is William.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seven letters. Billy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or … Willy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What kind of mother’s gonna call her kid Willy unless she wants his ass kicked every day at the playground?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, fifteen seconds. Your call, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Billy. Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s off. … She’s off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Castle. Listen. Thank you for staying with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect timing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You good?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Did she see?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Glad to see you, Detective. Even you, Mr. Castle. I have to say, I don’t know too many men who would have done what you did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Neither do I.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, for heaven sake, Detective. Just kiss the man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, you know?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What? Do you think I’m an idiot? I needed to maintain plausible deniability, which I can continue, as long as you two both act professionally at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know I can, but Captain, she has a long history of coming on to me at work –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think it will be a problem, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Good. Meanwhile, as long as we’re on neutral ground here, I’d say uh, he deserves it. Wouldn’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir, I would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know Castle, when I was standing up there I kept thinking about all the times we’ve kissed. And I was trying to decide on the best one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we’re just getting started.
